channel.title: [tut]Matrix background[tut]
channel.description:
And, yes before anyone says it. This tut is totally ripped ok? I am posting it for the benefit of these forums :)
step 1:
Start a new document of size 400x400 pix make sure u select the background as white and press 'd' to reset the colour to the photoshop defaults i.e. black foreground and white background.
step 2:
Now let us add some falling grains to the image for that go to Filter>Texture>Grain and add the settings as
Step 3:
Let's add some glow to it so what it shines more
Filter>Atristic>Neon glow
Step 4:
now it look a bit similiar isn't it. Let's make it a bit sharper so it looks better.
Select Filter>Sharpen>sharpen More
and our matrix effect is ready.
and to see the end result look at the 4th one here http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,18631.0.html
Official tut is here : http://www.pslover.com/click/7829
